instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 3115, ambient air temp sensor error
threads.message:
the board was liquid damaged, corrosion was on the SMC and u5410 area.

it didn't turn on initially, after reflow then replaced SMC from a donor then now the board power up except fan goes high.

ASD reports Ambient Air temp error, memory temp errors and a bunch of other temp errors.
ASD hardware monitor reports, these sensors reading is -124. which means these sensors is not working, 


Power to U5511 is ok

pull up resistors R5260-R5261 = 3.4v on both side

diode mode on pin9-10 of U5511 is 0.511

r5512, r5511, r5510 is in spec.
r5511 pin1 gets 3.3v, pin2 is pulsing from 3.269-3.29v

I've already replaced u5511, q5520, and SMC




have i used a bad SMC from a donor board?

threads.title: 3115, ambient air temp sensor error
threads.message:
Do you get correct AVREF_SMC voltage?
First replace trackpad board/flex with known good working.
Check traces from U5511 to Q5510/15/20.
Also test disconnecting J3502.

threads.title: 3115, ambient air temp sensor error
threads.message:
AVREF_SMC - 3.29v

trackpad/ js3502, yep, did these before.


U5511 to Q5510/15/20. traces all good.

threads.title: 3115, ambient air temp sensor error
threads.message:
Try other SMC.
Check traces from SMC to U5511, before replace it (once pulled out).

threads.title: 3115, ambient air temp sensor error
threads.message:
wow, what are the fecking chances!!!

SDA ball wasn't solder due to flux turned solid and blocking the pad.

[IMG type="full"]https://i.imgur.com/0zXhaIh.jpg[/IMG]

[IMG type="full"]https://i.imgur.com/0J6Fsge.jpg[/IMG]

I've cleaned, applied new flux and placed the SMC back in and reflowed into place without reballing.


now is working :)

threads.title: 3115, ambient air temp sensor error
threads.message:
"flux turned solid and blocking the pad"
Do you use chinese honey flux???
This shouldn't happen with Inventec/Amtech...

threads.title: 3115, ambient air temp sensor error
threads.message:
nope, amtech 599 real stuff. no idea how it happens.

could also be burnt edge bonding that i didn't clean probably.
